description: Smallest k such that 1/k can be written as a sum of exactly 2 unit fractions in n ways.
comments: Square root of n-th term of A061283. a(n)=Sqrt[Min{k| A000005(k)=2n-1}]. If n = p(i) = p, a prime, then a(p) = 2^[(p-1)/2] = 2^A005097(i). - _Labos Elemer_, May 22 2001a(n+1)<=2^n.
formula: Least k such that (tau(k^2)+1)/2=n. - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Aug 01 2001
mathematica: f[j_, n_] := (Times @@ (j(Last /@ FactorInteger[n]) + 1) + j - 1)/j; t = Table[0, {50}]; Do[a = f[2, n]; If[a < 51 && t[[a]] == 0, t[[a]] = n; Print[{a, n}]], {n, 2^30}] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 03 2005 *)
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_
extensions: Entry revised by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 14 2005
